additionalCleaningCriterias.name: TOC
additionalCleaningCriterias.description: TOC is applicable to any residue containing significant amounts of organic carbon and is based on oxidising the carbon present and measuring the carbon dioxide produced.

additionalCleaningCriterias.name: pH
additionalCleaningCriterias.description: pH is a measure of the hydrogen ion concentration and can be used to complement Conductivity measurements.

additionalCleaningCriterias.name: Conductivity
additionalCleaningCriterias.description: Conductivity measurement is a method to detect dissociated ionic substances in water samples. It is often used to measure cleaning agent residues (e.g., caustic or acidic agents).

additionalCleaningCriterias.name: AA
additionalCleaningCriterias.description: Atomic Adsorption can be used for measuring metals in solution, where the metal is part of a formulation or for unknown residues, such as suspected rouge.

additionalCleaningCriterias.name: Odour
additionalCleaningCriterias.description: Odour Verification is used to test that there is no residual smell of the previously manufactured Product

additionalCleaningCriterias.name: RC
additionalCleaningCriterias.description: This can be used to verify if the rinses collected from Equipment Parts or the Equipment in a whole are clear or not

variables.name: Body Weight (for LD50 dose)
variables.description: Body Weight of the Patient taking the next Product
variables.defaultValueReason: Average Body Weight of an Adult

variables.name: Modification Factor for Cleaning Agents
variables.description: Cumulative Modification Factor, selected by a Toxicologist for converting LD50 to ADE
variables.defaultValueReason: As recommended by the PDA Technical Report 29

variables.name: Safety Factor
variables.description: Safety Factor of a Drug Active used for Dosage based Residue Limits
variables.defaultValueReason: As recommended by Pharmaceutical Process Validation: Second Edition (I. R. Berry, R. A. Nash, eds.)

variables.name: Surface Area Limit (SAL) for APIs on Indirect Product Contact Surfaces
variables.description: Fixed Limit to be used for Indirect Product Contact Surfaces (IPCS)

variables.name: Surface Area Limit (SAL) for Cleaning Agents on Indirect Product Contact Surfaces
variables.description: Fixed Limit to be used for Indirect Product Contact Surfaces (IPCS)

variables.name: Verification Period
variables.description: The frequency after which an Equipment needs to be periodically verified once a validation is completed
variables.defaultValueReason: Periodic Verification is set to be done annually
